description.narrative:
Statens domstolsförvaltning har ansökt till Sida om medel för att finansiera en inledningsfas för ett nytt program i Bosnien och Hercegovina. Budgeten för inledningsfasen är 3,2 MSEK och tidsramen är mellan februari-juli 2020.
Bidraget är ämnat för stöd av en 5-månaders inledningsfas. Målet är att BiH (HJPC) och dess utvalda svenska partners, svenska Domstolsverket och svenska Kronofogden ska lämna in ett samordnat och väl underbyggt projektförslag, som ska presenteras av HJPC, till Sveriges ambassad i juli 2020.
Det föreslagna bidraget är till en inledningsfas till ett nytt projekt, förbättrad domstolseffektivitet och ansvarsskyldighet för domare och åklagare, ICEA-fas III,
Under perioden februari till juli 2020 kommer ett nytt programdokument att utarbetas.

The Swedish National Court Administration has applied to Sida to fund an Inception phase for a new programme in BiH. The budget for the Inception phase is 3.2MSEK and the timing is February-July 2020.
The contribution is for support of a 6 month Inception phase. The objective is for the High Judicial and Prosecutorial Council of BiH (HJPC) and its chosen Swedish partners, the Swedish National Court Administration (SNCA) and the Swedish Enforcement Agency (SEA) to deliver a coordinated and well substantiated project proposal, which is to be presented by the HJPC to the Embassy of Sweden in July 2020.
The proposed contribution is an Inception phase to a new project, the Improving Court Efficiency and Accountability of Judges and Prosecutors, ICEA phase III,
During the period February to July 2020, a new programme document will be elaborated.

The overall purpose of the inception phase was to ensure that the Swedish National Court Administration-SNCA and the Swedish Enforcement Authority-SEA delivered a coordinated and well substantiated contribution, with regards to their respective commitment, to the project proposal for Improving court efficiency and accountability-ICEA III to be submitted by the Bosnia Herzegovina High Judicial and Prosecutorial Council (HJPC) to the Embassy-Sida.

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: In March it became clear that the project elaboration workshop-WS planned in Sarajevo would not be possible due to the outbreak of Covid-19. The management team of HJPC, SNCA and SEA together with the RBM expert consultant therefore redesigned the WS. The inception phase has reached the overall goal set out and has delivered one common project proposal and three separate budgets to Sida within the timeframe set out. The proposal includes a common log-frame, workplan, a monitoring scheme and a risk analysis which all aim to incorporate the recommendations and conclusions reflected in the NIRAS’ evaluation and to ensure increased transparency and flexibility with more attention to communication on monitoring and results. By making use of the LFA-method the project teams could move from ideas to objectives and design methods to achieve these.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
